problem_text: The main lesson of this sample problem is this: It is perfectly all right to choose an easy path instead of a hard path. Figure shows a $2.0 \mathrm{~kg}$ block of slippery cheese that slides along a frictionless track from point $a$ to point $b$. The cheese travels through a total distance of $2.0 \mathrm{~m}$ along the track, and a net vertical distance of $0.80 \mathrm{~m}$. How much work is done on the cheese by the gravitational force during the slide?
